Watch.Name: Clock Watch
Watch.Description: The round timer as an int - range is 99 down to 0

Watch.Name: P1-Health
Watch.Description: Player 1 health as a short

Watch.Name: P2-Health
Watch.Description: Player 2 health as a short. Range 0 to VARIES - typically 900 to 1100

Watch.Name: P1-Super
Watch.Description: Player 1 super bar as a short. Range is 0 to 1000

Watch.Name: P2-Super
Watch.Description: P2 super bar as a short. Range 0 to 1000.

Watch.Name: P1-Ultra
Watch.Description: Player 1 ultra bar. Range 0 to 400 as short.

Watch.Name: Main-Menu-Option-Tracker
Watch.Description: Tracks the 11 options (0 to 11) which may be selected on the main menu

Watch.Name: Submenu-Text
Watch.Description: Gets UTF16 text from submenus to identify options

Watch.Name: Arcade-Menu-Difficulity-Option
Watch.Description: Says Easiest, Very Easy, Easy, Medium etc.

Watch.Name: Arcade-Menu-Num-Rounds
Watch.Description: Number of rounds for arcade - this is NOT the same as ranked match invite rounds.

Watch.Name: Arcade-Menu-Round-Time
Watch.Description: Options are 30, 60, 99 or Infinity.

Watch.Name: Arcade-Menu-Bonus-Stage-Toggle
Watch.Description: On or Off as a string.

Watch.Name: Arcade-Menu-Fight-Req-Rounds
Watch.Description: How many rounds fight requests should be for. Options are ANY, 1, 3, and 5.

Watch.Name: Arcade-Menu-Fight-Req-Time-Limit
Watch.Description: 30, 60 or 99 only as strings.

Watch.Name: Arcade-Menu-Fight-Reg-Region
Watch.Description: Options are ANY or SAME as strings.

Watch.Name: Arcade-Menu-Fight-Req-Skill
Watch.Description: Can be ANY, SAME SKILL or MORE SKILLED as case sensitive string.

Watch.Name: Character Select P1
Watch.Description: Keeps track of player 1 character selection.

Watch.Name: Arcade Menu Record Match
Watch.Description: Options are ON or OFF as strings

Watch.Name: Multiplayer Battle Submenu Text
Watch.Description: The submenu text for the Multiplayer Battle menu.

Watch.Name: P2 Ultra bar
Watch.Description: Player 2's ultra bar. Range 0 to 1000 as a short.

Watch.Name: Options Menu Submenu Text
Watch.Description: Submenu text for the main options menu.

Watch.Name: Button Config Options
Watch.Description: Button settings as integer. Range 0 through 19.

Watch.Name: Graphic Options Submenu Text
Watch.Description: Resolution, filtering settings etc. Matched as strings.

Watch.Name: Character Select P2
Watch.Description: Keeps track of player 1 character selection.

Watch.Name: Training Mode Pause Menu
Watch.Description: Menu options. Double. Range 0 through 9.

Watch.Name: Training Mode Training Options Menu
Watch.Description: Range is 0 to 11 as double.

Watch.Name: Training Mode Submenu Text
Watch.Description: String. This is for all options except difficulty and network frame lag simulation.

Watch.Name: Training Mode Training Options Difficulty
Watch.Description: Difficulty of CPU opponent in training. EASIEST, VERY EAST etc.

Watch.Name: Training Mode Training Options Simulated Lag Frames
Watch.Description: Range is 0 through 20 inclusive.

Watch.Name: Options Menu Graphics Resolution
Watch.Description: The resolution setting as an int. Range 0 (640x480) to 18 (1920x1080).

Watch.Name: Options Menu Graphics VSync
Watch.Description: On or Off as an int with value 0 or 1

Watch.Name: Options Menu Graphics Framerate
Watch.Description: Variable/Fixed/Smooth. Ints 0, 1 or 2.

Watch.Name: Options Menu Graphics Anti-Aliasing
Watch.Description: Ints - range 0 through 6 inclusive.

Watch.Name: Options Menu Graphics Filtering
Watch.Description: Ints - range 0 through 4 inclusive. The value 1 occurs twice - for "Default" and for "2x"

Watch.Name: Player 1 X Location
Watch.Description: Range is -3.5 to +3.5 as a float.

Watch.Name: Player 2 X Location
Watch.Description: Range is -3.5 to +3.5 as a float.

Watch.Name: Player 1 Status
Watch.Description: Crouching = 2, Airborne = 4, Counterhit-able = 16. Works as int but likely a bitfield.

Watch.Name: Player 2 Status
Watch.Description: Crouching = 2, Airborne = 4, Counterhit-able = 16. Works as int but likely a bitfield.

Trigger.Name: Clock GameState (isClock)
Trigger.Description: Keeps track of whether we're in game or in menu by watching for clock movement

Trigger.Name: P1 Health 500
Trigger.Description: Triggers when player 1 health is 500 or less

Trigger.Name: P1 Health 250
Trigger.Description: Triggers when player 1 health is 250 or lower

Trigger.Name: P1 Health 100
Trigger.Description: Triggers when player 1 health is 100 or lower

Trigger.Name: P1 Super - Got 1 bar
Trigger.Description: Triggers when p1 super reaches 250 or greater

Trigger.Name: P1 Super - Got 2 bars
Trigger.Description: Triggers when P1 super is 500 or greater

Trigger.Name: P1 Super - Got 3 bars
Trigger.Description: Triggers when P1 super is 750 or greater

Trigger.Name: P1 Super - Full
Trigger.Description: Triggers when P1 super is 1000 or greater

Trigger.Name: P1 Ultra - Half
Trigger.Description: Triggers when player 1 ultra bar hits 200 or higher

Trigger.Name: P1 Ultra - Full
Trigger.Description: Triggers when player 1 ultra bar hits 400 or greater.

Trigger.Name: P2 Super 1
Trigger.Description: Triggers when P2 super is at least 250

Trigger.Name: Options Menu Filtering 0 - Default
Trigger.Description: Says filtering setting. This is option 0, but matches on value 1.

Trigger.Description: Says filtering setting. This is option 1, but matches on value 0.

Trigger.Name: Options Menu Filtering 2 - 2x DISABLED USE DEFAULT
Trigger.Description: Default is 1, as is 2x - so we'll have this here but disabled so we know we didn't forget anything.

Trigger.Description: Says filtering setting. This is option 3, but matches on value 2.

Trigger.Name: Options Menu Filtering 4 - 8x

Trigger.Name: Versus-Menu-Edition-Select
Trigger.Description: Triggers based on submenu text [33 chars max or hits null char]
Trigger.Value: Turns on Edition Select. You can

GameConfig.Description:
Street Fighter IV GameConfig - Al Lansley - 2017-08-16
This config ships with SoniFight and provides alerts for clock values, health, super bar and ultra bar for both players - as well as a large number of (but not all possible) menu sonification events to assist in navigating menus and selecting characters without the need to memorise menu options.
Known Issues: At present there are some occassional non-sensical sonifications, such as between rounds, but there may be ways to avoid this as I've added some functionality to allow recursive "dependent triggers" on any normal trigger. By this I mean, you can specify a dependent trigger (by id number), and if the main trigger matches conditions but the dependent doesn't - then the original trigger sample isn't played. See the docs for more details.
Unfortunately in some circumstances random sample playing may be unavoidable because memory gets re-used for storing various data and there isn't too much that can be done about this issue besides disabling the offending trigger(s) [which is a perfectly acceptable solution] - because we're either watching a memory address for a change in its status, or we aren't - and there isn't any middle ground. Use what works best for you.
GameConfig.ConfigDirectory: 01 - Ultra Street Fighter IV Arcade Edition v2.0.0.93908
